        public ImageHandlingBuilder(EmailBuilder parent,

        Parameters:

    • Method Detail

      • inline

        public ImageInliningBuilder inline()
        Configures how images are handled. Image handling consists of defining how images are inlined in the email:
        • Either inlining directly in the HTML content by enconding image into base64 string
        • Or attaching the image to the email and referencing it using a Content-ID (CID)
        • Or no inlining
        This builder is used to enable the inlining modes (and to configure them). Several modes can be enabled.

        If ImageInliningBuilder.attach() is called, it enables image attachment. Image defined in a html must be referenced by a Content-ID (or CID) if the image is attached to the email. For example, if your template contains the following HTML code: 

         
    <img src="classpath:/foo.png" ogham-inline-mode="attach" />
        Then the image will be loaded from the classpath and attached to the email. The src attribute will be replaced by the Content-ID.

        If ImageInliningBuilder.base64() is called, it enables inlining by converting image content into base64 string and using the base64 string as image source. For example, if your template contains the following HTML code: 

         
    <img src="classpath:/foo.png" ogham-inline-mode="base64" />
        Then the image will be loaded from the classpath and encoded into a base64 string. This base64 string is used in the src attribute of the <img>.

        If you don't want to inline a particular image, you can set the "ogham-inline-mode" attribute to "skip": 

         
    <img src="classpath:/foo.png" ogham-inline-mode="skip" />
        Then the image won't be inlined at all.

        If no inline mode is explicitly defined on the <img>: 

         
    <img src="classpath:/foo.png" />
        The behavior depends on what you have configured:
        • If ImageInliningBuilder.attach() is enabled (has been called), then image will be loaded from the classpath and attached to the email. The src attribute will be replaced by the Content-ID.
        • If ImageInliningBuilder.attach() is not enabled (never called) and ImageInliningBuilder.base64() is enabled (has been called), then the image will be loaded from the classpath and encoded into a base64 string. This base64 string is used in the src attribute of the image.
        • If neither ImageInliningBuilder.attach() nor ImageInliningBuilder.base64() are enabled (never called), then images won't be inlined at all
        Returns:
        the builder to configure image inlining
